intro: Hieracium dialasium, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in the summer, and it produces small, elongated achenes as its seeds. Hieracium dialasium is often found in disturbed habitats and can be an invasive species in certain regions.
